taxation_system.overview: The Han Dynasty established the foundational taxation system for imperial China, combining land taxes, poll taxes, and corvée labor obligations.

major_reforms.reform: Reduced land tax from 1/15 to 1/30 of harvest
major_reforms.source: Hanshu, Treatise on Food and Money

tax_categories.description: Tax on agricultural land based on harvest yield
Per capita tax on adult population
Mandatory labor service for public works

obligations.alternatives: Cash payment in lieu of service

estimates.academic_source: Scheidel, W. (2009). 'Rome and China: Comparative Perspectives on Ancient World Empires'

total_tax_burden.regional_variations: Higher in core regions, lower in frontier areas
total_tax_burden.social_distribution: Regressive - higher burden on peasants relative to income
